item.title: Awk Introduction
item.description: Many of us know awk only as a command line tool for quickly editing output from a previous command. Few are aware that it is a fully fledged programming language. The fact that awk comes already installed on most Linux and Unix systems should be more than enough to highlight the importance of knowing its capabilities. It is useful for a system administrator to be able to quickly put together an awk script that formats some input into a report, or to perform some math calculations from a file’s contents.
